page.title: 15An Appraisal,Ravensthorpe.
page.content: An appraisal of Ravensthorpe was comp- leted by the Parish Council in l983.The questionnaire returned by 74% of house- holds revealed an overall picture of a village whose residents found it peace- ful,friendly,unspoilt and picturesque. It is near to a town with good rail and road links and newcomers are received well.Concerns were expressed about speeding vehicles and large lorries passing through;an imbalance in the housing mix with too many executive type houses;the lack of gas,primary school,extra shops,public transport and a doctor's surgery;lastly fouled foot- paths and verges with attendant litter. However a close study left the impression that the majority think well of their village.The Chairman asked for help to keep village life alive-support local traders,attend village events and serve on committees which need support.
